001package bradleyross.music.external;
002import java.io.File;
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.InputStream;
005import javax.sound.midi.MidiDevice;
006import javax.sound.midi.Sequencer;
007import javax.sound.midi.Sequence;
008import javax.sound.midi.MidiSystem;
009import javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException;
010import javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException;
011// import javax.sound.midi.*;
012// import java.io.*;
013
014
015
016
017/* http://blog.taragana.com/index.php/archive/how-to-play-a-midi-file-from-a-java-application/ */
018
019
020/**
021 * Plays a midi file provided on command line.
022 * 
023 * <p>The first and only parameter is the name of the file to be played.</p>
024 * 
025 * <p>This is based on the GitHub Gist item <a href="http://gist.github.com/indy/360540"
026 *    target-"_blank">indy/play_midi_filejava</a>.  It was mentioned in
027 *    <a href="http://blog.taragana.com/index.php/archive/how-to-play-a-midi-file-from-a-java-application/"
028 *    target="_blank">
029 *    http://blog.taragana.com/index.php/archive/how-to-play-a-midi-file-from-a-java-application/</a></p>
030 * @author Bradley Ross
031 *
032 */
033
034public class MidiPlayer {
035        /**
036         * Main driver program.
037         * 
038         * <p>The code for verifying that it is a MIDI file needs to be improved.</p>
039         * 
040         * @param args The first and only argument is the name of the file to be played
041         */
042        protected String args[];
043        public MidiPlayer(String value[]) {
044                args = value;
045        }
046        public static void main(String args[]) {
047                MidiPlayer instance = new MidiPlayer(args);
048                instance.run();
049        }
050        protected void run () {
051                String file;
052                Sequence sequence = null;
053                // Argument check
054                if(args.length == 0) {
055                        /*
056                         * Instead of exiting if the name of a MIDI file is not provided,
057                         * the code was modified to play a MIDI file contained in the jar
058                         * file instead.
059                         */
060                        try {
061                                InputStream in = MidiPlayer.class.getClassLoader().getResourceAsStream("AGNICRT.MID");
062                                sequence = MidiSystem.getSequence(in);
063                        } catch (InvalidMidiDataException e) {
064                                e.printStackTrace();
065                        } catch (IOException e) {
066                                e.printStackTrace();
067                        }
068                } else {
069                        try {
070                                file = args[0];
071
072                                if(!file.toLowerCase().endsWith(".mid") && !file.toLowerCase().endsWith(".midi")) {
073                                        helpAndExit();
074                                }
075
076                                File midiFile = new File(file);
077                                if(!midiFile.exists() || midiFile.isDirectory() || !midiFile.canRead()) {
078                                        helpAndExit();
079                                }
080                                sequence = MidiSystem.getSequence(new File(file));
081                        }catch (InvalidMidiDataException e) {
082                                e.printStackTrace();
083                        } catch (IOException e) {
084                                e.printStackTrace();
085                        }
086                }
087                // Play once
088                try {
089                        Sequencer sequencer = MidiSystem.getSequencer();
090                        sequencer.open();
091                        sequencer.setSequence(sequence);
092                        // sequencer.open();
093                        sequencer.start();
094                        System.out.println("Starting Sequencer");
095                        while(true) {
096                                if(sequencer.isRunning()) {
097                                        try {
098                                                Thread.sleep(1000); // Check every second
099                                        } catch(InterruptedException ignore) {
100                                                break;
101                                        }
102                                } else {
103                                        break;
104                                }
105                        }
106                        // Close the MidiDevice & free resources
107                        sequencer.stop();
108                        sequencer.close();
109                } catch(MidiUnavailableException mue) {
110                        System.out.println("Midi device unavailable!");
111                        mue.printStackTrace();
112                } catch(InvalidMidiDataException imde) {
113                        System.out.println("Invalid Midi data!");
114                        imde.printStackTrace();
115                } 
116        }  
117        /** Provides help message and exits the program */
118        private static void helpAndExit() {
119                System.out.println("Usage: java MidiPlayer midifile.mid");
120                System.exit(1);
121        }
122}
